New Records: South Africa inflicted a record ODI defeat on England by 229 runs.
England suffered their heaviest defeat by runs in ODIs.
South Africa posted the second-highest total in the tournament with 399-7.
Heinrich Klaasen hit the second quickest hundred in this tournament, after Aiden Markram’s 100 off 48 balls against Sri Lanka.
Key Match Events: Marco Jansen made an unbeaten 75 off 42 balls.
England were dismissed for 170 in only 22 overs.
Gerald Coetzee took 3 wickets for 35 runs.
Mark Wood scored 43 not out off 17 balls.
South Africa plundered 143 runs in the last 10 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler admitted, 'It leaves us with no room for error. We probably have to win every other game we play from here on, and that’s the situation we’re in.'
Heinrich Klaasen said, 'That hundred is up there with my best ever. The conditions were brutal. It’s proper heat and saps the energy out of you.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's win cemented their third spot with six points.
England sank to ninth in the table, tied on two points with last-place Afghanistan.
